examples: Oh, that's hilarious! [chuckle] Chatterbox Turbo is at FAL on day 1!.
text.description: The text to be converted to speech. You can add paralinguistic tags: [clear throat], [sigh], [shush], [cough], [groan], [sniff], [gasp], [chuckle], [laugh]
text.title: Text

voice.description: Preset voice to use for synthesis. Choose from available voices or provide a custom audio URL.
voice.title: Voice

audio_url.description: Optional URL to a custom audio file (5-10 seconds) for voice cloning. If provided, this overrides the preset voice selection.
audio_url.title: Audio Url

temperature.description: Temperature for generation. Higher values create more varied speech patterns.
temperature.title: Temperature

seed.description: Random seed for reproducible results. Set to 0 for random generation.
seed.title: Seed

prompts.description: List of voice descriptions for each text. Must match the length of texts list. Each describes the voice/character attributes.

sample_rate.description: Output audio sample rate for all generations. 48 kHz provides higher quality, 24 kHz is faster.

MayaStreamInput.description: Input schema for Maya-1-Voice streaming TTS generation

repetition_penalty.title: Repetition Penalty
repetition_penalty.description: Penalty for repeating tokens. Higher values reduce repetition artifacts.

examples: Realistic male voice in the 30s age with american accent. Normal pitch, warm timbre, conversational pacing, neutral tone delivery at med intensity.
Creative, dark_villain character. Male voice in their 40s with british accent. Low pitch, gravelly timbre, slow pacing, angry tone at high intensity.
prompt.description: Description of the voice/character. Includes attributes like age, accent, pitch, timbre, pacing, tone, and intensity. See examples for format.
prompt.title: Prompt

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: Nucleus sampling parameter. Controls diversity of token selection.

examples: Hello world! This is a test of the Maya-1-Voice text-to-speech system.
The darkness isn't coming... <angry> it's already here!
text.description: The text to synthesize into speech. You can embed emotion tags anywhere in the text using the format <emotion_name>. Available emotions: laugh, laugh_harder, sigh, chuckle, gasp, angry, excited, whisper, cry, scream, sing, snort, exhale, gulp, giggle, sarcastic, curious. Example: 'Hello world! <excited> This is amazing!' or 'I can't believe this <sigh> happened again.'
text.title: Text

output_format.description: Output audio format. 'mp3' for browser-playable audio, 'wav' for uncompressed audio, 'pcm' for raw PCM (lowest latency, requires client-side decoding).
output_format.title: Output Format

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: Maximum number of SNAC tokens to generate (7 tokens per frame). Controls maximum audio length.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Sampling temperature. Lower values (0.2-0.5) produce more stable/consistent audio. Higher values add variation.

sample_rate.description: Output audio sample rate. 48 kHz uses upsampling for higher quality audio, 24 kHz is native SNAC output (faster, lower latency).
sample_rate.title: Sample Rate

MayaStreamInput.title: MayaVoiceStreamingInput

MayaInput.description: Input schema for Maya-1-Voice TTS generation

repetition_penalty.title: Repetition Penalty
repetition_penalty.description: Penalty for repeating tokens. Higher values reduce repetition artifacts.

examples: Realistic male voice in the 30s age with american accent. Normal pitch, warm timbre, conversational pacing, neutral tone delivery at med intensity.
Creative, dark_villain character. Male voice in their 40s with british accent. Low pitch, gravelly timbre, slow pacing, angry tone at high intensity.
prompt.description: Description of the voice/character. Includes attributes like age, accent, pitch, timbre, pacing, tone, and intensity. See examples for format.
prompt.title: Prompt

top_p.title: Top P
top_p.description: Nucleus sampling parameter. Controls diversity of token selection.

examples: Hello world! This is a test of the Maya-1-Voice text-to-speech system.
The darkness isn't coming... <angry> it's already here!
That's hilarious! <laugh> I can't stop <laugh_harder> thinking about it!
<whisper> I have a secret to tell you. <excited> You won't believe what happened!
text.description: The text to synthesize into speech. You can embed emotion tags anywhere in the text using the format <emotion_name>. Available emotions: laugh, laugh_harder, sigh, chuckle, gasp, angry, excited, whisper, cry, scream, sing, snort, exhale, gulp, giggle, sarcastic, curious. Example: 'Hello world! <excited> This is amazing!' or 'I can't believe this <sigh> happened again.'
text.title: Text

output_format.description: Output audio format for the generated speech
output_format.title: Output Format

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: Maximum number of SNAC tokens to generate (7 tokens per frame). Controls maximum audio length.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: Sampling temperature. Lower values (0.2-0.5) produce more stable/consistent audio. Higher values add variation.

sample_rate.description: Output audio sample rate. 48 kHz provides higher quality audio, 24 kHz is faster.
sample_rate.title: Sample Rate

examples: Hello world! Welcome MiniMax's new text to speech model <#0.1#> Speech 2.6 Turbo, now available on Fal!
prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: Text to convert to speech. Paragraph breaks should be marked with newline characters. **NOTE**: You can customize speech pauses by adding markers in the form `<#x#>`, where `x` is the pause duration in seconds. Valid range: `[0.01, 99.99]`, up to two decimal places. Pause markers must be placed between speakable text segments and cannot be used consecutively.

normalization_setting.title: Normalization Setting

duration_ms.description: Duration of the audio in milliseconds
duration_ms.title: Duration Ms

tone_list.description: List of pronunciation replacements in format ['text/(pronunciation)', ...]. For Chinese, tones are 1-5. Example: ['燕少飞/(yan4)(shao3)(fei1)']
tone_list.title: Tone List

voice_id.description: Predefined voice ID to use for synthesis
voice_id.title: Voice Id

english_normalization.description: Enables English text normalization to improve number reading performance, with a slight increase in latency

enabled.description: Enable loudness normalization for the audio

strength.description: The strength of the emotional style transfer. Higher values result in stronger emotional influence.
strength.title: Strength

examples: You scared me to death! What are you, a ghost?
emotion_prompt.description: The emotional prompt to influence the emotional style. Must be used together with should_use_prompt_for_emotion.
emotion_prompt.title: Emotion Prompt

should_use_prompt_for_emotion.description: Whether to use the `prompt` to calculate emotional strengths, if enabled it will overwrite the `emotional_strengths` values. If `emotion_prompt` is provided, it will be used to instead of `prompt` to extract the emotional style.
should_use_prompt_for_emotion.title: Should Use Prompt For Emotion

text.description: The text to be converted to speech (maximum 300 characters). Supports 23 languages including English, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, Hindi, Arabic, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and more.
text.title: Text

custom_audio_language.description: If using a custom audio URL, specify the language of the audio here. Ignored if voice is not a custom url.
custom_audio_language.title: Custom Audio Language

exaggeration.description: Controls speech expressiveness and emotional intensity (0.25-2.0). 0.5 is neutral, higher values increase expressiveness. Extreme values may be unstable.
exaggeration.title: Exaggeration

voice.description: Language code for synthesis. In case using custom please provide audio url and select custom_audio_language.
voice.title: Voice

temperature.description: Controls randomness and variation in generation (0.05-5.0). Higher values create more varied speech patterns.
temperature.title: Temperature

seed.description: Random seed for reproducible results. Set to 0 for random generation, or provide a specific number for consistent outputs.
seed.title: Seed

cfg_scale.description: Configuration/pace weight controlling generation guidance (0.0-1.0). Use 0.0 for language transfer to mitigate accent inheritance.
cfg_scale.title: CFG Scale

audio.description: The generated multilingual speech audio file
audio.title: Audio

ChatterboxhdTextToSpeechInput.description: Input parameters for the TTS request.

text.title: Text
text.default: My name is Maximus Decimus Meridius, commander of the Armies of the North, General of the Felix Legions and loyal servant to the true emperor, Marcus Aurelius. Father to a murdered son, husband to a murdered wife. And I will have my vengeance, in this life or the next.

exaggeration.description: Controls emotion exaggeration. Range typically 0.25 to 2.0.
exaggeration.title: Exaggeration

high_quality_audio.description: If True, the generated audio will be upscaled to 48kHz. The generation of the audio will take longer, but the quality will be higher. If False, the generated audio will be 24kHz.
high_quality_audio.title: High Quality Audio

voice.description: The voice to use for the TTS request. If neither voice nor audio are provided, a random voice will be used.
voice.title: Voice

audio_url.description: URL to the audio sample to use as a voice prompt for zero-shot TTS voice cloning. Providing a audio sample will override the voice setting. If neither voice nor audio_url are provided, a random voice will be used.
audio_url.title: Audio Url

temperature.description: Controls the randomness of generation. Range typically 0.05 to 5.
temperature.title: Temperature

seed.description: Useful to control the reproducibility of the generated audio. Assuming all other properties didn't change, a fixed seed should always generate the exact same audio file. Set to 0 for random seed.
seed.title: Seed

cfg.description: Classifier-free guidance scale (CFG) controls the conditioning factor. Range typically 0.2 to 1.0. For expressive or dramatic speech, try lower cfg values (e.g. ~0.3) and increase exaggeration to around 0.7 or higher. If the reference speaker has a fast speaking style, lowering cfg to around 0.3 can improve pacing.
cfg.title: Cfg

ChatterboxhdTextToSpeechInput.title: TTSInput

ChatterboxhdTextToSpeechOutput.description: Output parameters for the TTS request.
ChatterboxhdTextToSpeechOutput.title: TTSOutput

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.
file_size.title: File Size

file_name.description: The name of the file. It will be auto-generated if not provided.
file_name.title: File Name

content_type.description: The mime type of the file.
content_type.title: Content Type

url.description: The URL where the file can be downloaded from.
url.title: Url

examples: I just found a hidden treasure in the backyard! Check it out!
text.description: The text to be converted to speech. You can additionally add the following emotive tags: <laugh>, <chuckle>, <sigh>, <cough>, <sniffle>, <groan>, <yawn>, <gasp>
text.title: Text

exaggeration.description: Exaggeration factor for the generated speech (0.0 = no exaggeration, 1.0 = maximum exaggeration).
exaggeration.title: Exaggeration

audio_url.description: Optional URL to an audio file to use as a reference for the generated speech. If provided, the model will try to match the style and tone of the reference audio.
audio_url.title: Audio Url

seed.description: Useful to control the reproducibility of the generated audio. Assuming all other properties didn't change, a fixed seed should always generate the exact same audio file. Set to 0 for random seed..
seed.title: Seed

model.description: TTS model to use for preview. Options: speech-02-hd, speech-02-turbo, speech-01-hd, speech-01-turbo
model.title: Model

examples: Hello, this is a preview of your cloned voice! I hope you like it!
text.title: Text
text.description: Text to generate a TTS preview with the cloned voice (optional)
text.default: Hello, this is a preview of your cloned voice! I hope you like it!

audio_url.description:
URL of the input audio file for voice cloning. Should be at least 10 seconds
            long. To retain the voice permanently, use it with a TTS (text-to-speech)
            endpoint at least once within 7 days. Otherwise, it will be
            automatically deleted.
audio_url.title: Audio Url

noise_reduction.description: Enable noise reduction for the cloned voice

text.description: The text to be converted to speech. You can additionally add the following emotive tags: <laugh>, <chuckle>, <sigh>, <cough>, <sniffle>, <groan>, <yawn>, <gasp>

voice.description: Voice ID for the desired voice.

repetition_penalty.description: Repetition penalty (>= 1.1 required for stable generations).

next_text.description: The text that comes after the text of the current request. Can be used to improve the speech's continuity when concatenating together multiple generations or to influence the speech's continuity in the current generation.
next_text.title: Next Text

speed.title: Speed
speed.description: Speech speed (0.7-1.2). Values below 1.0 slow down the speech, above 1.0 speed it up. Extreme values may affect quality.

examples: Hello! This is a test of the text to speech system, powered by ElevenLabs. How does it sound?

text.title: Text

timestamps.description: Whether to return timestamps for each word in the generated speech
timestamps.title: Timestamps

voice.description: The voice to use for speech generation
voice.title: Voice

language_code.description: Language code (ISO 639-1) used to enforce a language for the model. An error will be returned if language code is not supported by the model.
language_code.title: Language Code

previous_text.description: The text that came before the text of the current request. Can be used to improve the speech's continuity when concatenating together multiple generations or to influence the speech's continuity in the current generation.
previous_text.title: Previous Text

timestamps.description: Timestamps for each word in the generated speech. Only returned if `timestamps` is set to True in the request.
timestamps.title: Timestamps
